intro: Pulsatilla slaviankae, commonly known as the Slavonian pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces follicle fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
